dean-list-y1s2.title: Dean's List (NUS School of Computing)
description: Owing to my efforts during the second semester of my first year in NUS, I received a 4.92 SAP. As a result, I obtained the coveted Dean's List, which is awarded to the top 5-10% of each cohort. Here are the modules I took this semester:
Metropolis: A City in World History (A-)

top-students-ethics.title: Top Students for Ethics in Computing
description: Obtained the subject award for IS1103: Ethics in Computing during the second semester of my first year in NUS.

ti-graphing.title: Texas Instruments Graphing Competition (Gold)
description: In 2017 and 2018, my favourite past time was

using the Desmos graphing calculator. This eventually led me to participating in design competitions, like this one by Texas Instruments. In the 2018 rendition, the theme was 'Towards a Smart Nation', where I created an
that eventually led me to win the Gold Award. It is to be noted that I also participated in the 2017 competition, where I obtained the Silver Award.

smo.title: Singapore Mathematical Olympiad (Silver)
description: I frequented the SMO for many years during my time in school, and I made it to the second round almost every time. But while a Silver Award is a good enough achievement, it was still unfortunate that I didn't manage to obtain any Gold Award in the end.
I also participated in 2013 and 2015, where I received the Bronze Award.

admin-support.title: Best Trainee Award for Admin Support Course
description: During the training period at the start of my National Service, I underwent training for my vocation. The training mainly consisted of basic Microsoft Office skills, as well as memorise a list of routine orders, and included multiple test components. Amongst the 50+ trainees during the programme, I managed to achieve the best results.
